comments:
Finance 412 provides students with an analytic framework for addressing how a corporation finances its activities and what investments it should make. Key aspects are the net-present-value approach to valuation and a portfolio approach to understanding risk. Topics include present-value techniques, valuation, the relationship between risk and return, capital market efficiency, the choice between equity and debt financing, and dividend policy. This course utilizes basic algebra; prospective participants who need to refresh their skills in this area can contact a WPWP representative for assistance before enrolling. Acct 411 or a familiarity with financial accounting is recommended.

Overall, this course was highly praised for being difficult yet rewarding. This course focused on “key and core concepts of this subject” and “helped students to have a strong foundation.” Many students thought “the materials used in class were well-chosen.” Students also praised this course for including a “great balance of lecture, class discussion, small group discussion, and real life analysis and application.” Some students said the workload at times was challenging but worthwhile. A few students hoped they could receive more guidance on the group project and that the course could encourage more tough questions.

The majority of students had nothing but high regards for Professor LaMay. Students described Professor LaMay as “extremely knowledgeable” and “very clear about the subjects.” Many students said he was able to stimulate students’ interest. His teaching skills and style were highly praised. Specifically, students complimented him on conveying the subject matter in an organized and straightforward manner “with humor and patience.” Students also said Professor LaMay had great passion for the course material, and he was “available for help.”

This class comes recommended to majors and non-majors alike. This course was offered for the last time in Fall 2012. This course utilized basic algebra; prospective participants who need to refresh their skills in this area can contact a WPWP representative for assistance before enrolling. Acct 411 or a familiarity with financial accounting is recommended.
